m_DescList: File extensions typically consist of a "." followed by letters, located at the end of filenames. The file extension indicates the storage format of the file.
<color=#3173FF>\w</color> matches any character of the word, usually containing uppercase and lowercase letters a-z, A-Z, underscores _, and digits 0-9
In C#, characters in different languages are also matched,
e.g. <color=#3173FF>\w</color><color=#FF68DD>+</color> matches <color=#3c3cff> 汉字, 日本語, 한국어, Português</color> in:
When users input file paths, match valid file extensions for proper inputs, and output nothing for invalid inputs.
Construct a regular expression that passes all tests on the right.
